hanzi-su-wiki:
貨

Значения

Товар, деньги; груз, поклажа

Мнемоника

Товары, грузы — все, что можно обратить 化 в деньги 貝.

Варианты

货

huò
goods; money; commodity; Classifiers: 个
товары; Деньги; товар; Классификаторы: 个
rtega_mnemonic:
貨貨RS
货货		goods, commodities, products
  • persons 亻匕 converting 化 money 貝 in products
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 货)
Pictophonetic: 化 indicates the sound; 貝 (money) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
貨幣 [ huò bì ]: currency; monetary; money
貨物 [ huò wù ]: goods; commodity; merchandise; Classifiers: 宗
貨車 [ huò chē ]: truck; van; freight wagon
貨運 [ huò yùn ]: freight transport; cargo; transported goods
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 化 [ huà ] to change, to convert, to reform; -ize
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
heisig_chinese_memo: Small commodities are transformed into shells (money) all the time in Yiwu, China.
heisig_constituent: freight, change, person, spoon, sitting on the ground, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
koohiiStory1: Freight is the shells (money) paid to change the location of something big. Don´t confuse with the similar 賃 fare (#1004).
koohiiStory2: This is a freight train that runs on spare change. Imagine getting on the freight train with a bunch of spare change. You put in some change and it starts up...goes for a few minutes, then starts to slow down. You look at the slot..there´s actually a slot for spare change and one for regular shells. Your call, but it seems to prefer spare change over shells.
jp_example_words:
外貨(がいか): imported goods, foreign money
貨幣(かへい): money, currency, coinage
雑貨(ざっか): miscellaneous goods, general goods, sundries
貨物(かもつ): cargo, freight, money or assets
硬貨(こうか): coin
通貨(つうか): currency
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You want to change your shellfish into freight so you can transport it. That means packing them up into giant freight containers.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine changing your shellfish from loose, wet form, to solid freight form. It's actually a lot of hard work.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: To move this freight, you need a car (か). You strap all of the freight containers to the top of your car, stacked nice and high and precarious, so you can move it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture all of this freight stacked on top of your car. As you drive the car, every turn you make feels slow and heavy from the freight weight.
Ru_Words:
宝たから
  • сокровище (прям. и перен.)
    • 貨物かもつ
  • груз, багаж; товары
    • 載荷さいか
  • груз, погрузка
    • 通貨つうか
  • деньги (денежные знаки); находящиеся в обращении; ходовая монета (данной страны)
    • warodai
    百貨ひゃっか
  • всевозможные товары
Ru_Radicals: 化 (превращаться), ハ, 匕 (ложка), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese: huò: (сущ) товар, продукция; валюта, деньги; (бран.) дурак, болван
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) changes (化) into freight
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Shells transform into commodities everyday all around the world.  Then they get put on a ship or train as freight.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " Bei " to " Hua " sound. The original meaning is the general term for Jinyububo. "Said Wen": "Goods, wealth." "Shang Shu. "Hong Fan" "Secondly Says Goods", Kong Yingda Shu: "Goods, the name of the gold, jade cloth and silk." "Han Shu. "Shihuo Zhi": "Food is the edible thing of the farmer Kagu, the goods are cloth, cloth, and tortoise shells, so we can divide the wealth of the goods." The extension refers to the goods. Such as "Easy. "Xi Ci": "Japan and China are the city, to the people of the world, gather the goods of the world, trade and return, and each has its own place." "Historical Records. The Standards Book: "The officials of the great peasants have exhausted all the goods in the world, and they will sell them if they are expensive, and buy them if they are cheap."

" Cai " and " goods " are sometimes used together in ancient books, such as "Historical Records. "Xiang Yu Benji": "When Pei Gong lived in Shandong, he was greedy for money, so Meiji." Although the original meanings of the two are different, they were later extended to the collective term for coins. "Xunzi. "Fu Guo", "So Tianye County, the root of wealth", Yang Yan's note: "Goods and wealth are the common names of Qiangu. In other words, corn cloth and silk are called wealth, and money cloth and turtle shells are also called goods." See also " Cai ". Examples of " goods " denoting coins are like "Han Shu. Shihuo Zhi: "The people are in a state of confusion, their goods are not good, and the private people buy it at the market for five baht." "Hou Han Shu. Kui Xiao Gongsun Shu Lie Biography: "When it is true, it is said that waste copper coins are used to buy iron official money, but the people's currency will not work." Another example is "inflation."

" Goods " also means bribery. Such as "Shang Shu. "Lu Xing": "Five faults, only officials, only opposition, only internal, only goods, only come." Cai Chen's collection: "Goods, bribes." "Zuo Zhuan. "Thirty Years of Xi Gong": "Ning Yu Huo Doctor, so that he can't die." "Mencius. "Gongsun Chouxia": "Give it from nowhere, it is a good thing."

" Goods " also means buying and selling, as in the Book of Hou Han. "Wu Yanshi and Luzhao Biography": "When the prince was sick, he came down to the county to produce precious medicine, and the general Liang Ji sent a visitor to Jingzhao, and bought bezoar." "Book of Jin. "Wang Rong Chuan": "The family has good plums, and they often ship them. They are afraid that people will get them. They will always drill their cores." Liu Zongyuan of the Tang Dynasty: "The Abandoned Land of the Tang Clan, but not for sale." "

" Goods " can also refer to people in modern Chinese, using things to refer to people as a derogatory term for people. For example, Chapter 12 of "The Scholars": "He is an unused commodity, he doesn't know how to farm, and he doesn't know how to do business." Chapter 3 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "He is a famous and hot seller here."
humanum_short_description_en: From " Bei " to " Hua " sound. The original meaning is the general term for Jinyububo.
humanum_full_description:
從「貝」，「化」聲。本義是金玉布帛的總稱。《說文》：「貨，財也。」《尚書．洪範》「二曰貨」，孔穎達疏：「貨者，金玉布帛之揔名。」《漢書．食貨志》：「食謂農殖嘉穀可食之物，貨謂布帛可衣，及金刀龜貝，所以分財布利通有無者也。」引申指貨物。如《易．繫辭下》：「日中為市，致天下之民，聚天下之貨，交易而退，各得其所。」《史記．平準書》：「大農之諸官盡籠天下之貨物，貴即賣之，賤則買之。」

　　「財」和「貨」在古書中時有連用，如《史記．項羽本紀》：「沛公居山東時，貪於財貨，好美姬。」兩者的本義雖有區別，後來皆引申為錢幣的統稱。《荀子．富國》「故田野縣鄙者，財之本也」，楊倞注：「貨、財，皆錢穀通名。別而言之，則粟米布帛曰財，錢布龜貝曰貨也。」參見「財」。「貨」表示錢幣的例子如《漢書．食貨志》：「百姓憒亂，其貨不行，民私以五銖錢市買。」《後漢書．隗囂公孫述列傳》：「是時，述廢銅錢，置鐵官錢，百姓貨幣不行。」又如「通貨膨脹」。

　　「貨」亦表示賄賂。如《尚書．呂刑》：「五過之疵，惟官，惟反，惟內，惟貨，惟來。」蔡沈集傳：「貨，賄賂也。」《左傳．僖公三十年》：「甯俞貨醫，使薄其酖，不死。」《孟子．公孫丑下》：「無處而餽之，是貨之也。」

　　「貨」還表示買賣，如《後漢書．吳延史盧趙列傳》：「時皇子有疾，下郡縣出珍藥，而大將軍梁冀遣客齎書詣京兆，并貨牛黃。」《晉書．王戎傳》：「家有好李，常出貨之，恐人得種，恒鑽其核。」唐代柳宗元〈鈷鉧潭西小丘記〉：「唐氏之棄地，貨而不售。」

　　「貨」在近代漢語中也可以指人，以物稱人表示對人的貶稱。如《儒林外史》第12回：「他是個不中用的貨，又不會種田，又不會作生意。」《紅樓夢》第3回：「他是我們這裡有名的一個潑辣貨。」
humanum_short_description: 從「貝」，「化」聲。本義是金玉布帛的總稱。

從「 貝 」，「 化 」聲。本義是金玉布帛的總稱。《說文》：「貨，財也。」《尚書．洪範》「二曰貨」，孔穎達疏：「貨者，金玉布帛之揔名。」《漢書．食貨志》：「食謂農殖嘉穀可食之物，貨謂布帛可衣，及金刀龜貝，所以分財布利通有無者也。」引申指貨物。如《易．繫辭下》：「日中為市，致天下之民，聚天下之貨，交易而退，各得其所。」《史記．平準書》：「大農之諸官盡籠天下之貨物，貴即賣之，賤則買之。」 「 財 」和「 貨 」在古書中時有連用，如《史記．項羽本紀》：「沛公居山東時，貪於財貨，好美姬。」兩者的本義雖有區別，後來皆引申為錢幣的統稱。《荀子．富國》「故田野縣鄙者，財之本也」，楊倞注：「貨、財，皆錢穀通名。別而言之，則粟米布帛曰財，錢布龜貝曰貨也。」參見「 財 」。「 貨 」表示錢幣的例子如《漢書．食貨志》：「百姓憒亂，其貨不行，民私以五銖錢市買。」《後漢書．隗囂公孫述列傳》：「是時，述廢銅錢，置鐵官錢，百姓貨幣不行。」又如「通貨膨脹」。 「 貨 」亦表示賄賂。如《尚書．呂刑》：「五過之疵，惟官，惟反，惟內，惟貨，惟來。」蔡沈集傳：「貨，賄賂也。」《左傳．僖公三十年》：「甯俞貨醫，使薄其酖，不死。」《孟子．公孫丑下》：「無處而餽之，是貨之也。」 「 貨 」還表示買賣，如《後漢書．吳延史盧趙列傳》：「時皇子有疾，下郡縣出珍藥，而大將軍梁冀遣客齎書詣京兆，并貨牛黃。」《晉書．王戎傳》：「家有好李，常出貨之，恐人得種，恒鑽其核。」唐代柳宗元〈鈷鉧潭西小丘記〉：「唐氏之棄地，貨而不售。」 「 貨 」在近代漢語中也可以指人，以物稱人表示對人的貶稱。如《儒林外史》第12回：「他是個不中用的貨，又不會種田，又不會作生意。」《紅樓夢》第3回：「他是我們這裡有名的一個潑辣貨。」

Although the original meanings of the two are different, they were later extended to the collective term for coins. "Xunzi. 貨字的基本解释

貨
huò
见“货”。

貨字的汉语字典释义

[①]［huò］
［《廣韻》呼卧切，去過，曉。］
“化3”的今字。“货1”的繁体字。
(1)财物，金钱珠玉布帛的总称。
(2)货物，商品。
(3)钱币。
(4)贿赂，买通。
(5)指给报酬。
(6)卖；出售。
(7)购买。
(8)对人的贬称（多为詈语和玩笑语）。

貨字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　貨； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1205第12
〔古文〕䞈?【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?呼臥切，火去聲。【說文】財也。【廣韻】貨者，化也。變化反易之物，故字有化也。【易·繫辭】日中爲市，致天下之民，聚天下之貨，交易而退。【書·洪範】八政，二曰貨。【傳】貨，寶用物。【周禮·天官·大宰】商賈阜通貨賄。【註】金玉曰貨。【前漢·食貨志】貨，謂布帛可衣及金刀龜貝，所以分財布利通有無者也。　又賂也。【左傳·僖二十八年】晉侯有疾，曹伯之豎侯獳貨筮史，使曰：以曹爲解。【註】貨，猶賂也。　又【玉篇】貨，賣也。　【六書故】作?。

貨字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
貨字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [huò]
["Guangyun" hustle and cut, I've been there, Xiao. ]
The modern word for "Hua 3". Traditional characters for "货1".
(1) Property, the general term for money, jade, cloth and silk.
(2) Goods, commodities.
(3) Coins.
(4) Bribery, buy-in.
(5) Refers to rewards.
(6) Sell; sell.
(7) Purchase.
(8) Derogation of people (mostly slurs and jokes).

Name meaning

huò
вм. 货
Radicals: 化, 貝  (change, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
You want to change your shellfish into freight so you can transport it. That means packing them up into giant freight containers.
Imagine changing your shellfish from loose, wet form, to solid freight form. It's actually a lot of hard work.
Reading Mnemonic
To move this freight, you need a car (か). You strap all of the freight containers to the top of your car, stacked nice and high and precarious, so you can move it.
Picture all of this freight stacked on top of your car. As you drive the car, every turn you make feels slow and heavy from the freight weight.
